author: {'steamid': '76561198079302409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 886, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 765, 'last_played': 1477438710}
review:
the game is one of the best visual novels i have ever seen! it constantly keeps you intrested wanting for more since it has the wonderfull story of the 47 ronin with a touch of harem (no ecchi stuff) involved in it since most of the samurais are females and even if you know the original story and how it ends its progression always makes you wonder if they will follow it or not. If i had a complaint it would be the price of the next chapters (DLC) which i find a bit expensive only because its a novel and its play time in numbered since its storytelling and not interactional in order to play different routes and stuff, although its duration was filling (14hours). i probably wont spend the amount of money to get the rest of the chapters and i am dying to know what happens next but still i reccomend it even if you only play chapter 1 like me. 

IF you are really into novels and plan on getting the dlc's too i Highly Recommend it because of the well-made characters and its great story..!

P.S!!! the tag nudity is BS probably people added it cause of some sideb00bs resulting from some a bit more skin revealing samurai outfits so if you are into that dont check it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965065599', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1392, 'last_played': 1476942088}
review:
After playing, I googled the 47 Ako Ronins, and it's seems to be based on that story :)

Enter the world where the main samurai characters are female instead. Although, this is only the first part I played, the story was very interesting and it draws you in. The characters in the visual novel is cute and kawaii as ever, which definitely gives some game hype and humor. They also have wonderful voice actors for this VN. The art style is perfect, and the music compliments the visual novel very well emotionally/atmospherically. The plot will draw you in to keep continuing with the story.

Although game tags say it contains nudity, it doesn't. It's more ecchi, and it can be positive or negative depending on different people's experiences. I believe the game is completely fine as it is though. 

The visual novel does not have choices to choose. It would be more interesting if choices were given, but then I believe it would kind of stray from the story of the 47 ronins.

Now I want to buy the other parts/sequels to the visual novel o_O

author: {'steamid': '76561198312330004', 'num_games_owned': 353, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 8491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4459, 'last_played': 1622958290}
review:
WARNING SPOILERS.    This was my first visual novel I have ever read. I thought I'd give it a try it since it was free. I did have my doubts, I love anime but I never really got into manga(weird I know) so I wasn't really confedent in this novel when I first got it. 

After I finished the first chapter of the of the novel, I was counting the days for the next chapter of the this novel because of how Romantic, Unusual, and the Action that I saw in this amazing plot. I love the characters such as the Chamberlain for her funny momments and romantic momments. Yasubee and Fuwa were fun to watch. I love Suguha and how he deals with his situation and how he becomes a bad-ass as the whole story progresses. Each ending of a chapter puts me at the edge of my seat. 

I say the same things to all of the other chapers like Edo Radicals, because it was awesome that Suguha loved Yasubee. Chapter 4 however left me asleep because of everyone talking back and forth all the time. I know thats how it is in the other chapters, but in those chapters the characters talked about subjects that progressed the story. Chapter 4 puts the whole story to a stand still and I actually left I the middle of a pointless conversation. The only part that was important were the 2 new character siblings that both that have suffered a tragedy. 

The final chapter however, absolutly blew it away. It started off being like chapter 4 with nothing but talk, but after a little bit of time the story progresses purfectly. I also loved how Suguha became a mastermind to turn the tables on the villian. 
The final battle was amazing with the war over the skeleton army and the main characters ghost. I LOVED Suguha's final battle as he battles the main villain for the people that he cares for. 

To be honest Suguha is the best part of the story. Not just because of the main character, but you see him develop from a highschool wimp to a epic bad-ass hero (and a woman's man). 

The music was amazing, the artwork is awesome. The story is mind blowing, Suguha develops beautifully. 

If you like visual novel with a little bit of everything, check this one out. I do recommend paying for the DLC it is totally worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120348301', 'num_games_owned': 1313, 'num_reviews': 433, 'playtime_forever': 7507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2898, 'last_played': 1483825500}
review:
Well, I never thought that a visual novel with a lot of fanservice could be this good. This is a kinetic novel (no choices, you only read), fully voiced (also the VA is great!!), with a nice art style and good BGM. This review is only about chapter 1, and I‚Äôve not played this game before, so please keep that in mind.

I loved this VN. At first I thought it was only about dem boobs but the story is really interesting, the characters are amazing, and some scenes actually made me cry (especially towards the end). There‚Äôs some what the f*ck scenes to please ecchi fans, but there‚Äôs a lot of character development and history too. At first I also disliked Suguha, but wow, that boy grew up [b]so much[/b]. I‚Äôm excited to read the next chapters, but I don‚Äôt think they can beat this first one. It was truly amazing.

8/10, give a chance to this title, after all, the first chapter is free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103916465', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2296, 'last_played': 1488066948}
review:
Das meiste was ich positives zu dem Spiel zu sagen habe, wurde schon in anderen Reviews erw√§hnt, ich spreche aber direkt eine definitive Empfehlung aus. Daher versuche ich mich m√∂glichst kurz zu fassen: 

Wen abschreckt dass es sich hier quasi um eine Kinetic Novel handelt (keine Entscheidungen, sondern quasi ein Buch im VN Stil lesen), der soll sich solange er VNs mag bzw. gut geschriebene B√ºcher & Storys, bitte davon nicht abschrecken lassen. 

W√§hrend die Story manche lockere Comedy-Elemente enth√§lt, ist dies hier sicherlich nicht das Hauptaugenmerk und etwaige Klischees in den Comedyszenen fand ich nicht st√∂rend sondern passend- der Gro√üteil der Story findet in der Zeit einer Variante des alten Japan statt.  Genauso wenig sollte man davon ausgehen, dass es hier Fanservice mit schwacher Story bzw. Verniedlichung von allem gibt, da man die Ako Ronin weitestgehend gegen Frauen ausgetauscht hat. (Die n√§chsten S√§tze dazu werden etwas repetitiv.) Nat√ºrlich ist es Fanservice die Ako Ronin etc. als Frauen darzustellen, aber anders als man vermuten k√∂nnte r√ºckt dies √∂fter als nicht in den Hintergrund und alles wird immer wieder sehr ernst und spannend. Oftmals wird die Situation also durch diese "√Ñnderung" aufgelockert und nat√ºrlich gibt es dadurch einige Klischeehafte Szenen die man so aus Anime kennt- dennoch: Die Story steht 100% im Vordergrund und ist detailliert und klasse wiedergegeben, die Klischees sind wirklich nur zwischendurch eingesetzt und tun der ganzen Sache keinen Abbruch- alle Charakter sind auf ihre Art und Weise klasse und beweisen im Laufe der Story Entwicklung und (emotionale) Tiefe. 

Ich gebe zu dass ich anfangs auch etwas skeptisch war- da das komplette erste Chapter (locker ~10 Stunden) kostenlos ist, kann sich hier aber auch jeder selbst ein Bild machen. Anfangs wirkt die Story wie nichts besonderes und auch nicht wirklich ernst- wer dem ganzen aber etwas Zeit gibt, wird bald eine Story entdecken, die einen nicht mehr so einfach losl√§sst. Der Protagonist durchl√§uft √ºber alle Kapitel ebenfalls eine stetige Charakterentwicklung- seine Ansichten & Ziele √§ndern sich gleicherma√üen wie seine F√§higkeiten und mentale Verfassung. Fantasy-Elemente gepaart mit Geschichtlichen Fakten der Genroku Era, sowie Zeitreise-Elementen, ausreichend Action/Kampf-Szenen, Drama und durchaus etwas Mystery versprechen zu unterhalten. Dazu kommt, dass sich das ganze erst nach und nach entfaltet- kann man die Geschichte √§ndern? Wieso konnte es √ºberhaupt zur Zeitreise kommen? Wieso gerade der Prota und wof√ºr? Kann ich wieder zur√ºckkehren- wenn ja wie und ist das wirklich von Dauer... Will ich das am Ende noch? 

Es ist schwer nichts ohne Spoiler zu schreiben, jedoch sollte gesagt sein dass die volle Story in 5 Kapiteln erz√§hlt wird und alles ein Gro√ües Ganzes bildet. Und wenn man denkt es k√∂nnte fertig sein, dann geht es gerade erst richtig los. Artstyle, Musik, Japanische Synchro, sowie Storytelling und Charakter sind alle klasse geschrieben- gebt dem ganzen eine Chance und vielleicht wird das hier einer euer Lieblinge des Genres ;)

P.S: Die Musik ist von der Lautst√§rke nicht wirklich ausbalanciert- ihr h√∂rt sie auch noch laut genug wenn ihr sie auf 10% stellt, ansonsten √ºbert√∂nt sie wom√∂glich den Dialog in den falschen Momenten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051804871', 'num_games_owned': 495, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 11429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3567, 'last_played': 1633467705}
review:
One of the best stories I have read. I felt all the emotions, it's truly a great story, by it's not really a game, as the only (two really, but the second one is really much of a choice) choice in the game is to continue the story at ones own pace. Don't get me wrong I love this story, but this game is not much of a game, rather a story book in digital form, so if you are buying this, just know you will not get any (but one which cause gameover) choices their can effect the story.

I played it again... still pretty good, even if you skip some parts. Well you get something for you're money, thats for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150051068', 'num_games_owned': 283, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 7535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5723, 'last_played': 1551617319}
review:
My very first visual novel. I don't think I will ever find another VN which is as good as this one. Apart from the ecchi parts(because there is quite a lot of those :D) both the art style and the audio of the game is awesome. The voice acting is superb. The whole plot is based on real historical events so you won't just read an awesome story but you will learn some Japanese history as well. I actually looked it up and not only the events match with the game's plot but even the characters' names as well. And there are some parts when they're talking about old Japanese things like money and the measurment for distance and land. So all in all this VN doesn't only provide you with a heartbreaking story and a really happy ending but some actual facts as well. This is a perfect example for learning while having fun. So if anyone that loves animes/mangas/VNs and is interested in Japanese history(and loves boobs) this VN is a must have. 10/10 would read again 1000 times.
PS:As I mentioned there are quite a lot of ecchi in it. And the final chapter is spent with Yatou Emosichi who is a litle girl. I guess you know what I mean. Chapter 5 is ful of loli. So any loli fans out there... have fun ;D
Edit: I've re-read the story. Even reading it for the second time it hasn't lost its charm. Inre did a really good job making this VN.
New edit: I've found out that there is actually another ChuSinGura VN which continue the story of this one however it hasn't been translated to English yet and there are no sings that it ever will be. The only thing we can do is hope that it will get translated.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046353792', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3757, 'last_played': 1588788186}
review:
Bon... Pour faire simple : Ce jeu est g√©nial. 
Si vous n'avez pas peur de claquer un peu d'argent sur un visual novel ou qu'ils sont en soldes, n'h√©sitez pas √† acheter les DLC pour obtenir les 4 autres chapitres du jeu.

Pour faire moins simple : 
Un sc√©nario profond, avec de nombreuses r√©f√©rences historiques et autres clins d'oeils sympathiques.
Une bande son utilisant souvent des instruments traditionnels japonais, pour augmenter encore plus l'immersion.
En plus, elle est excellente et tr√®s bien coordonn√©e pour l'ambiance.
Les personnages sont tr√®s attachants, voire parfois trop (Difficile d'avaler la mort de certains).
Le d√©veloppement des personnages laisse tr√®s rarement √† d√©sirer, mais quand c'est le cas, √ßa signifie g√©n√©ralement qu'il n'√©tait pas si important, donc c'est pas grave.
Et honn√™tement... CE TWIST AU DERNIER COMBAT DU DERNIER CHAPITRE !!! (Sans vouloir spoil, vous comprendrez ce que je veux dire avec "m***e, c'est pas parce qu'ils n'avaient pas assez de budget en fait !" quand vous saurez qui est le "grand m√©chant" et ce qu'il a fait pour que le h√©ros danse dans la paume de sa main)
En plus, toutes ces th√©ories sur l'histoire sont plut√¥t passionantes (Je trouve personnellement que l'Histoire est une mati√®re tr√®s ch***te, mais l√† j'√©tais franchement sur le c*l)

author: {'steamid': '76561197995321994', 'num_games_owned': 1521, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 5726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2699, 'last_played': 1554171441}
review:
ChuSingura 46+1 S is a visual novel developed by Inre. For those new to this concept, visual novels are interactive games that have very few choices if any at all. The concept might seem boring, but those interested in books ChuSingura is a jewel among VNs. It is also one of the games that will make you think of your own life and wonder what would you do different if you could travel back in time?

The main protagonist is Fukami Suguha, an average Japanese student that ends up transported back in time during the Genroku era in 1701 CE. The story essentially deals with the 47 Ronins and their plans to avenge their lord unjustly while also restoring the family‚Äôs honor. It is a story of courage, bravery, romance, mystery, magic and duty. 

The game is excellent when it comes to provoking emotions in the player thanks to the amazing special effects used when the samurai are fighting with their swords, the music and the imagery. Some moments will be so touching that the player will shed tears. 

I personally did not encounter any bugs with the game, but there were some minor translation errors, although nothing major.

Each chapter of ChuSingura is excellent and so far I played the 3 released. I think it is worth giving a try considering the fact chapter 1 is free for everyone and chapter 2 and 3 are bundled for 20$. Each chapter deals with the same story but someone else‚Äôs perspective as well as different events. 

Overall, I think ChuSingura is one of the best visual novels I‚Äôve read and I would gladly recommend it to anyone (heck, first chapter is free, so why not?). I give the game overall with its dlc a 9.5 (lost 0.5 for the minor translation errors). It is a must have in your collection.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997753928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 6349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4546, 'last_played': 1494921687}
review:
People looking for smut will be disappointed with ChuSingura since Steam had it neutered, and people that like a quality story will overlook it thanks to the rediculous overly large breasts with obligatory nipple outlines screaming that this is, at face value, an unsophisticated smutty game. But it proved otherwise.

Since all that's left is story and gratuitous fanservice, It's a suprisingly witty adventure with incredible plot twists, tragedy, and good humor. And seriously.. Best selling point is it's free. Why, I certainly dont know. Maybe its their way of compensating viewers for eventual boob-blindness.


The DLC could use some graphical and translation fixes, but the next 2 chapters were worth the cash despite suffering from numerous such errors. The length of these chapters is no joke.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998859782', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 9669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2918, 'last_played': 1588271183}
review:
First off, this is NOT a game.
It has 0, ZERO, interactions needed (except 1 time in chapter 3) from the person reading this.
It is however a damned good visual novel, even if it obviously had the more "adult" parts taken out due to Steam's policy.

TLDR:
If you like Visual Novels, this is a "SHUT UP AND TAKE MY MONEY!!" buy.
If you don't know if you like visual novels, get Chapter 1 anyways, IT'S FREE.
Then you'll either go "Not my thing." or "SHUT UP AND TAKE MY MONEY!!"



I'd highly recomend anyone who want to try out or are wondering if visual novels is something for them to get the first chapter since its FREE. 

The story revolves around the 46 named Ronins and one Ronin which historically is still ambigious and depending on the research you look up, either counts or discount that last participant. Which is a nice touch since in this VN, that last Ronin is you, time traveled from mordern 21st centuary. 

This is one of the things that stood out to me. 
That this VN is actually quite accurate historically not just with names and locations, but also referencing ancient units of measurement from distance to time and hour of the day.
The fact that all the Samauri involved are now mostly boxom women or cute lolis *matters not!*
most of the actions that they took as told in Chapter 1 can be crosschecked against historical records and studies. 

Minus one tweeny event at the end. (Look up East Asian Myths "White Snake" Japanese Variant)
Liberties are of course taken. :)

There are enough twists, turns and story perspectives going from Chapter 1 (free) to Chapters 2 and 3 (1st DLC) that if the first chapter had captured you, by the time you end at the current availble chapters (2-3) you will be wanting chapters 4 and 5 with "SHUT UP AND TAKE MY MONEY!!" mindset.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002353572', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 4259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3056, 'last_played': 1477138269}
review:
Not too big into VNs usually since I don't see the appeal. I saw the first chapter of this one up for free and was impressed by the production quality of the CGs and was kinda bored so I gave it a try not knowing what to expect.

Ended up binging through all of it during the course of a few weeks. I think the reason is that this VN is less about choices (there's a grand total of 1 so far which just bad ends you) and romancing. It's just a straight story.

The pacing, world / character building and atmosphere in the VN totally hooked me in. Each chapter is essentially a new loop through the same basic set of events, but you get to genuinley experience it all from a different prespective and tone each time which was really cool. You can tell that the writer wanted to make the most out of the ground hog day premise to make sure that it didn't get too boring or perdictable. Each chapter does a very good job building up the stakes anew which culminates in very powerful scenes near each ending. And the really cool thing with the writing in my opinion is that even with only 3 of the 5 chapters, you still get what would be a pretty strong conclusion to the story by chapter 3, so I definitley feel like I got my money's worth here. The last two chapters feel like they'll just be tying up a few loose ends so I don't mind the wait.

The only sore spots with this VN mainly lie in the translation quality. I could mostly look past it and just fill in the gaps myself but there's a decent number of grammer errors and typos that indicate that chapter 2 and 3 were rushed to meet the deadline. If waiting longer means we get a more refined translation for the next 2 chapters then again, I don't mind.

Overall I definitley recommend giving the first free chapter a try to see if this might be your thing, and I am looking forward to the last 2 chapters!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014831291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2055, 'last_played': 1641983823}
review:
Just finished chapter 3 and wanted to write a review.
So... where to begin with? Maybe with the minor negative points:
Its not really a game, because you can't influence the story. (one minor decision).
Maybe its only on my computer, but sometimes there is a bug where the character displayed is way bigger than the screen. Fixed by reloading the picture.
And especially in the 3rd chapter, some english mistakes. (like spelling "I" (for me) like "i", or sometimes repeating some words)
BUT: Its a beautiful story about a timetraveller going back to an alternative 17th century japan, living by the side of samurai girls getting revenge for their unjustifiedly killed master. 
I was actually sometimes crying because of the depth of the emotion of all the characters.
The Artwork is breathtaking, and I haven't seen so stunning manga artwork for long.
The sound is exactly what it needs to be, enough suttle not to disturb the story but to improve it.

Well, I can't really discibe how awesome that it is, but I recommend everyone who likes to read and is able to understand english or japanese, and maybe is a bit interested in japanese history to download this game. Can't wait for chapter 4 and 5

author: {'steamid': '76561198081884334', 'num_games_owned': 908, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 5496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1055, 'last_played': 1611435121}
review:
Personalmente me encantan las novelas visuales. ChuSingura46+1 S me esta encantando, me acabo de completar el capitulo 1 y ya quiero ver que sucede en los dem√°s cap√≠tulos.
Definitivamente la recomiendo. Les va a encantar la historia e incluso se van a encari√±ar con los personajes.
Aunque no tiene su contenido +18, pero es de esperarse, espero que saquen un parche en un futuro.

[h1]Valoraci√≥n personal:[/h1]
8/10

review:
Stop cutting material from the whole. It's not fair to the consumers or content creators to leave out segments. Paying for an incomplete version just leaves me with a bad impression, which sucks because this was a great read.

 I like the pay structure, 1 chapter free and dlc 2 and 3 if you really enjoyed it you can continue.

But seriously, if I liked it enough to BUY it. It truly isn't fair to cut or forceably censor an art piece when I know what I'm getting myself into.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993402400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1787, 'last_played': 1472440885}
review:
I have never played a visual novel before this one.  I've been mildly curious about them, but never enough to shell out any actual money.  So when this one popped up on my radar as being FREE, well hey, I'm willing to risk that kind of money.

I took a look at the Steam page and said "Man, that looks a little fan-servicey".  And normally that's the kind of thing that would turn me away from a product.  But "FREE" was the key word here, so I figured "What the Hell?" and downloaded it.

And it turns out that it's pretty good.

I thought I was getting "Baywatch Nights", but set in Edo-era Japan.  I figured I'd watch it for 30 minutes, maybe an hour, and roll my eyes a lot.  Instead, I got "Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon", plus cleavage.

As I say, this is my first visual novel ever, so I dunno how it compares to any other visual novels.  But it was very enjoyable.  Very compelling romance/adventure story with some genuinely moving scenes.  I've already ponied up for chapters 2 & 3 and look forward to reading those, too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044198152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 6047, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3827, 'last_played': 1620093906}
review:
Fantastic visual novel with a great story.  Don't bother playing/buying if you're only looking for knuckle ammo as there is no 18+ content, though if you do get off to fully-dressed cartoons... well, whatever toots your whistle...   The story alone is enough to have me on edge waiting for second DLC to drop, chapters 4/5.  

And yes, I had a tear or two at end of chapters 1 & 2, and had more than a few at near-end of chapter 3...
Watch chapter one!  If you have any interest whatsoever in the samurai genre, even if you've never heard of the 47 Ronin, Read This Visual-Novel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198038743618', 'num_games_owned': 362, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 663, 'last_played': 1472246056}
review:
7/10 

This is a retelling of the 47 ronin. A modern day student goes to an alternate past where many of the 47 ronin are women.

This type of visual novel has zero choices. It is 100% railroaded. Some might be inclinded to pass on this vn because of that, but you may want to still give it a shot since the first chapter is free. 

Truthfully, the quality of this VN is high tier. The animation, story, writing, and music are above the average. There are definetly reasons to laugh and cry in this game. I'll probably pick up the DLC chapters, but there are other vns I'd rather take a look at then continue this right now.

Each chapter is roughly 10 hours of play each.

Note there are no H-patches for this game. The publishers don't intend to release one, but this doesn't really take away from the game as it is still complete without it. You're missing out on 11 H scences over 5 chapters and loli slapstick which I'm glad to be without. *you will not find an english version of this game anywhere with the H-scences*

Download chapter 1, see how you like it. Don't bother searching for H-patches, they don't exist and aren't needed. If you like chapter 1, you'll want to buy the dlc for 2-5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030408286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 2371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1463, 'last_played': 1476912417}
review:
At first, all you'll see is your stereotypical heavy cleavage, Japanese themed visual novel. Which it is, but at the heart of a cheap marketing tactic lies something of a hidden gem.

Protagonist is a bit of an arse at first, but develops as time goes on, which is unusual.

The story is genuinely interesting (unlike most VN's with a heavy focus on how the women look), with unexpectedly likeable and interesting outlooks on life.

Really unlikeable antagonists (always good).

The only downfall is, actually, too much focus on the cleavage/semi nudity, because it cheapens the experience. Because the story's so good, this would have been better without it.

Definitely get this if you like VN's.

review: Certain visual novels draw you in, entice you to read on with abandon, unable to truly detached from the characters and story even when you are away from the screen.  ChuSingura is one of those events, having now completed all three chapters I am vacant not knowing when our journey will recommence.  Each chapter takes between 10 ‚Äì 11 hours to complete, so allot of content is covered and this makes the novel fantastic value.  The art style is nice, the game appeared to flow without glitches for me, and, although the ‚Äòstory‚Äô remains similar in each chapter, the journey you are taken on differs significantly in each play through.  I cannot wait for the next chapters to be announced.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990425293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 4259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3985, 'last_played': 1487586817}
review:
This visual novel is basically about a talented protagonist that has lost his desire to nurture his own talent in Kendo, then coincidentally gets transported back to a time where pride and honor are still important qualities of a swordsman. He is forced to go through many hardships, but then tragedy strikes and he was given another chance through time traveling. Beyond this is major spoilers, but let's just say that he struggles mentally because of this 'curse'. He goes through hardship and self-loathing, and yet he seeks to save those he cared about; but at the same time, seek for salvation. A journey where his personality constantly changes depending on the new experiences he continues to go through, while looking for a way back to his own time. 

The first three chapters was the struggle, and the last two chapters can be considering the turning points of the story. I honestly think the first three chapters could've stood on it's own, but it is still good to see a continuation of the character's interactions in the last two chapters.

The first three chapters covers three of the four girls with their own romantic routes. The forth is the revealing chapter that gives us the answers. The last chapter is the last heroine and the finale. I won't say which chapter belongs to which heroine, so you'll have to find out yourself. This VN has an enforced playing order, so you cannot choose whose route you can play first.

Personal visual novel score: 8.3/10
https://vndb.org/u40815

Known length of Visual Novel: Over 50 hours

review:
ChuSingura46+1 S is an game that plays in a mysterious time in japan.

You where just a normal student but then the fate grabs you and you awake in the past.Now your in the role of Suguwa Fukami what will the fate hold up for you ?
Will you return to the modern time or even find your love of your heart ?
You will see it in the good desinged 5 Episodes of this game.

The graphic is mostly drawn and it's really good.
There are non fan support things in it and it even don't need it thanks to this really good story
One Episode will take around 3-9 hours and there are 5 of it.

I recommend this game because of its beautiful story to anybody.
[b][10.3/10] Points[/b]

[spoiler]The Story would continued but the next game isn't out yet.[/spoiler]

review:
ChuSingura46+1 S geht um den Sch√ºler Fukami Suguha, der sp√§ter durch unbekannte Gr√ºnde in die edo √Ñra gebracht wird.  
Ich finde die Story sehr kreativ, da in jeden Chapter eine andere Perspektive der Story gezeigt wird. Die Animation der k√§mpfe und der personen find ich sehr gelungen. author: {'steamid': '76561198039137828', 'num_games_owned': 585, 'num_reviews': 323, 'playtime_forever': 1052, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1052, 'last_played': 1470249829}
review:
[h1]ChuSingura46 + 1 S ist eine Visual Novel von Inre.[/h1]

Eins Vorweg. Dieses Spiel besitzt keinerlei Gameplay. Es geh√∂rt zu jenen VN¬¥s, in denen man keine einzige Entscheidung treffen kann. Wer so etwas nicht mag kann hier bereits aufh√∂ren zu lesen.

[b][i]Story[/i][/b]

Alle die das nicht st√∂rt oder die dem Spiel dennoch eine Chance geben wollen k√∂nnen sich auf eine sehr gute Story freuen. Die Handlung basiert zu gro√üen Teilen auf der popul√§ren japanischen Geschichte der 47 Ronin. Hier mal der [url= https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/47_R%C5%8Dnin] Wikipedia-Link [/url] f√ºr alle interessierten. 

Diese ohnehin schon sehr packende Geschichte wird sehr clever mit Fantasy und Sci-Fi Elementen (z.B. Zeitreise) vermengt und durch diese "aufgefrischt". Dass die Samurai √ºberwiegend von weiblichen Charakteren dargestellt werden, h√§tte wegen mir nicht sein m√ºssen, wird aber sicherlich den ein oder anderen m√§nnlichen Spieler dazu bewegen die VN zu testen. Zudem gibt es dadurch auch noch eine Liebesgeschichte die sich durch das halbe Spiel zieht und dem ganzen noch etwas mehr Spannung verleiht. 

Die einzelnen Charaktere haben alle eine ganz individuelle Pers√∂nlichkeit die auch recht glaubhaft vermittelt wird. Viele der Charaktere wachsen einem w√§hrend der Geschichte dann auch richtig ans Herz, zumindest ging es mir so.

[b][i]Grafik[/i][/b]

Optisch macht das Spiel insgesamt einen guten Eindruck. Es gibt viele Hintergr√ºnde, die allerdings leider etwas detailarm sind. Da h√§tte ich etwas mehr erhoft. Allerdings gibt es zahlreiche Eventbilder (f√ºr die es leider keine Gallerie gibt) die daf√ºr um so besser aussehen. Zudem sind die Charaktere sehr gut gestaltet und auch mit vielen Details versehen.

[b][i]Sound[/i][/b]

Vertont ist ChuSingura leider nur auf japanisch, was dem ganzen allerdings mehr Authentizit√§t verleiht. Den englischen Untertitel fand ich √ºberwiegend verst√§ndlich. Wer √ºber normales Schulenglisch verf√ºgt sollte im groben klarkommen. Die einzelnen Musikst√ºcke sind gut gelungen, insbesondere jenes, das gegen Ende des 1ten Kapitels kommt macht Laune. Die einzelnen Sounds sind ansonsten auch ganz ok, schwanken aber leider etwas stark was die Lautst√§rke angeht.

[b][i]Fazit [/i][/b]

Insgesamt muss ich sagen, das ChuSingura eine der besten VN¬¥s ist, die ich kenne. Allerdings darf man sie eben nicht als Spiel sehen, sondern eher als digitalen Comic/Manga/Graphic Novel. Wer sich f√ºr die japanische Geschichte im allgemeinen oder speziell f√ºr Samurais interessiert sollte sich dieses Werk unbedingt einmal ansehen. Gleiches gilt f√ºr Manga und Anime Fans und auch VN Freunde k√∂nnen ruhig mal einen Blick hierrauf werfen, schon allein weil das erste Kapitel kostenlos ist und mal abgesehen von den letzten 5-10 Leseminuten auch in sich abgeschlossen ist. Man ben√∂tigt also nicht zwingend die Folgekapitel. Ich habe zum durchlesen des kostenlosen Kapitels im √ºbrigen gut 17 Stunden ben√∂tigt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198301045711', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2889, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1628, 'last_played': 1565279521}
review: I am only on chapter 2 and OMG! This is only visual novel that has made me cry so hard. I could fill an entire glass of water with my tears. I cannot believe my eyes, there so much emotion in this visual novel it is ridiculous. I cried like a baby a in the first chapter, and the second chapter halfway through it made me cry. And the soundtrack, it is sooooo good. The only word I can use to describe the music is that is a one of a kind master piece. I won't say anything on the new chapters for spoilers and because this MASTER PIECE of a visual novel deserves the funding. It deserves every single dollar they ask for, as long it is not as ridiculous as activision with the DESTINY dlc's, they DESERVE and NEED the money. Master pieces like this one promise a lot. And for those who want a 18+ patch don't you guys worry, we will get it if we ask them enough times. This visual novel still has a long way to go so I ask for my fellow Ako Ronin, DO NOT LOOSE FAITH, WE WILL GET OUR BOOBS.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148064215', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1481458679}
review:
This game is a really nice RPG game i would definately recommened. But i've noticed a problem with one of the texts Suguha use's once he goes back in time, on the 10th of January 1701. I'm going to quote it for you.

Suguha:
"Nothing...

I guess the term Spring's first south wind doesn't exist yet...
Phew, it's annoying how i have to be careful of the worlds I use."

I think the word is mean't to be word, but either way. Good game, i really love the background music and the feel for the game.
(I forgot to save this chapter and dont exactly want to go back until i've finished the first chapter. ;-; Someone please comment on this review if you go by a piece of text like the one above and say if they fixed it or not so i can remove this little segment of the review.) 
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Found something else, not sure wherever it is a error or not, but later on the "It's almost been 2 months..." chapter, there's a sentence from Mansunojou that doesn't sound right.

Matsunojou:
"Then naturally, people tend to curry favor with me."

& theres one of Suguha as well later on

Suguha:
"Huts like hell..."

Jut thought i'd like to let you know as i play. Making sure to pay close attention! Thank you for the game aswell :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198003751718', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 14060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1509, 'last_played': 1552842923}
review:
Before trying the visual novel people should really look up on it's informaton for example on VNDB.

The visual novel has the tag of "Enforced Playing Order", that means any choices you made won't have any big impact onto the game's endings, like a kinetic visual novel basically. 

Technically you are reading a book from page 1 to page 100.  I don't particularly mind about this setting since I am someone who has played over 200+ Visual Novels. But it can sure be annoying to some.

The CG gallery and extras will be unlocked the moment you complete the game on the first chapter. There are several text bugs but they were patched out now by the Devs.

This is one of the best visuals novels out there in my opinion available in English, one words, Higurashi, and it is a very good one. The art is decent and the best thing about the game was the plot +  story. Also the fact that it relates to the real 47 ronins historical event so you can learn more about Japanese History.

The only downside in my opinion is that there are no 18+ content patch, sadly from what I've heard the devs stated they will not be doing this since this was ported from all age version. Personally I've played the Japanese version and have viewed almost all the H-scenes, we're not really missing much contents so its still decent. 

But it wouldn't hurt to have it to be honest. They can easily add that at some point in the future if they want more sales, it won't be too hard to just add an external link on their website outside of steam to do this.

Although there are several chapters, The first chapter is completely free as 1 Route so if you don't mind playing "Enforced Playing Order" visual novels do give this one a try.

Although this Visual Novel has some ecchi moments in it, don't play it for Nudity or Ecchi stuff   

Play for the Story/ Plot > Boobs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009396717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 915, 'last_played': 1469654170}
review:
Very enjoyable. I sat down and played for the full 15.3 hours on this Visual Novel without stopping and really read at an enjoyable pace to absorb everything (I don't like reading books if that says anything to ya). I normally don't play Visual Novels very much but this was well worth playing! I look forward to more of this quality or even a continuation if there will ever be one. 
All I can say is that this is an emotional rollercoaster if you like having "connections" with characters as well as love a good storyline -- then you've got to give this a play through.

Wonderful job on this -- I highly recommend.

The only con I could say would be a few keyboard stumbles on some words (about 4 or so words I think it was) but other than that, over the course of 15.3 hours, well done!

review: This visual novel is really good. The visuals are amazing and the characters are captivating within the anime genre that makes me want to have a harem of these girls. The story has a nice twist to it and if this is just the first chapter i can't wait for the rest. For those who are wondering if this is a game worth trying then you should definitely should.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136377163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1475963102}
review: This is by far one of my favorite visual novel I've ever played. The visuals are amazing and the characters are captivating. The story has a nice twist to it and I love the character development the most. For those who are wondering if this is a game worth trying then you should definitly should. Playing the game is almost just like reading a manga but able to hear the character's voice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097523775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1096, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1044, 'last_played': 1645568350}
review:
I enjoyed this game.  You can't make any choices which I found strange and It's diffrent from the games I play but it did not matter that much because the story pulls you in making you want to know what happens next.
I am looking forward to see what happens next in chapter's 2 and 3.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102795734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1471382900}
review:
Oh man.... This is such a great visual novel. While the shifting stills turn me off from time to time, the story itself is fantastic. [spoiler] I love how the MC isn't always just some invisible character as well, like many VNs like this.[/spoiler] It took me longer than I thought to finish, but it was definitely a good investment considered how much I loved the story. It almost makes you forget about the boobs. Almost. [spoiler] And now I play the waiting game for the newer chapters... [/spoiler]

[spoiler] P.S. if you read the spoilers (i.e. THIS), then you'd probably see that they're arguably not spoilers. To me, however, revealing any aspect of an experience best done on your own is what I consider a spoiler. I'm just here to input my two cents. Take it or leave it. Thank you for taking the time to read my rant. [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198043705931', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 620, 'last_played': 1496880097}

author: {'steamid': '76561198216721353', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1487307933}
review: By far an amazing project. When I saw that there was only one chapter I was a little set off but I decided to try it and it blew me away. The one chapter alone provided hours of experience and was topped by characters with wonderful personalities and a story line with such great detail. I believe this one chapter alone could have been its own story but I am glad it is not. I am eagerly awaiting more and I hope this project is seen through to the end. I thank the creators and all who are working on it because it is tuly a masterpiece.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113530727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 978, 'last_played': 1469323660}
review:
Great graphics, voices and characters, also great story line. Some of the music is good at times but it's mostly on and off with the music. Generally but other than that it's a really good novel to watch.


Edit~ This is a really emotional investing novel. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a story that can really get you into what's happening and allow you to actually empathize with the characters. The voices are slow but that doesn't stop the meaning or the emotional experience of the story. So check this game out if you are interested in such an amazing high quality story arch. 
Warning: You will cry!

P.S. You WILL be heartbroken.

P.P.S. I wish the story could continue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198213959208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 7035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1382, 'last_played': 1479241651}
review: It's one of the best VN i've ever played. You can learn very much about the history of Japan and it's very entertaining to follow the story. You don't get to choice the storylines like in other VN, cuz it's about real historcal events but it isn't a downside. Sometimes there're comedy aspects too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034502466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1470021056}
review:
I'm a History Major and Japanese history has always been a fascination for me. Yes this game is Fiction, and yes all of the samurai are women and yes the story is not 100% accurate but you know what? I don't care.

If you want a true idea of what it was like for the 47 Ronin who threw away everything they had to avenge their lord out of loyalty and honor then this is a good place to start. Don't watch the crappy 47 Ronin movie. Start here and then learn the true history because this game, despite being fanservice(Nothing wrong with that at ALL) is a good first step. 

I want to thank the creators of this game for putting me in Shuguha's shoes and giving me, an American, a first hand look at what it was like in Tokugawa Japan in the time of the 47 Ronin. This is a game that I think everyone should play if you like a good story, and like to be immersed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103237376', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1468807883}
review:
Not a game at all, but a linear "graphic novel" set in mediaeval Japan. All the warriors are women, and the Shogun is a little girl who likes to play with her dog. Apparently it's a retelling of a story known as the 47 ronin.

I haven't seen any nudity or sex, unless you count cleavage as nudity, which I don't.

Not recommended, unless you're specifically interested in Japanese history.

review:
Didnt think i would like this but finished my last book about a month or so ago and havnt found anything decent to read since.  Thought id try one of these visual novels and i love it,  Its hard for me to save and quit at times as i want to know what happens next.   Great graphics, sounds and plot.  

Oh yeah, im 34 and married so i didnt come for the boobs, not that im complaining.

Only thing that bugs me is that they refer to woman as he/him/sir ets.  Other than that its a great read/game.  9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198125147874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1468601360}
review:
ChuSingura46+1 is a visual novel about the 47 ronin, if those ronin would (almost) all be women and if there would be one man amongst them from the future, trapped in feudal Japan after a mysterious curse that somehow involves a solar eclipse and fortune cards put him there. So not really a realistic depiction of this historical event.

If you want to know if this VN is one for you, answer the following questions:
-Do you like slice-of-life elements and silly trope characters? Because that will be most of the story for the first half.
-Do you like loooooong VN stories? Because this is one of those.
-Do you like harem stories? And I mean the kind where every woman is attracted to you for no apparent reason once you give them even the slightest hint of attention or affection.

If your answer to any of these questions isn't a solid no, you have a fair chance of liking this game.

Pros:
-The shojo elements of the story are surprisingly good for a VN; the protagonist's choice to pick up the sword again, his training and the enemies he fights all feel natural and good. It would have been really easy for them to screw this up by making him overcome his adversity to swordfighting too abrupt or forced but they didn't.
-Some characters are good or likable and the roles that are too trope are either small enough for this to be understandable or not taken serious to begin with. This with the exeption of the daylight lamp.
-There are a lot more sprites than a free-to-play VN player like me is used to. Various outfits, little details, lots of expressions, and most of all the small roles. For not only the roles so small that they could've easily been written out completely, but also the insignificant characters like the Kira servants to get their own sprites is quite unique for the $0 VN's.

Cons:
-This is a completely kinetic story, no choices at all. I wouldn't mind this so much if they hadn't picked such an unusual choice to be your romantic interest, but they did.
-While I praised the shojo elements before, the actual action scenes are not really good. In between the sword fights that are pretty much just still frames with a vpunch effect and the sprites that are being moved around a little too much for too long, the action scenes actually felt like the slowest scenes in the story sometimes.
-This is more a minus to Japanese story telling in general, but the freaking flashbacks. If you're giving me a flashback of something they said literally just one minute ago, you're giving me the idea you see me as a 5-year old. The explaining of things isn't actually as bad here as it can be in other Japanese stories, but they give so many unneccesary flashbacks and repetition of dialogue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020828800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1142, 'last_played': 1468698884}
review:
It's not a game, but just a story... Was hoping to have choice to do but no, only a story to follow.
At first I've been disapointed, but I've truely been taken into the story and I'm now waiting for next episode.

I do recommand this for manga fans who like a great interesting story, manga girls with big boobs and learning about a real famous story of japanese culture. But dont expect any erotism or porn as you wont have this at all^^

Can't wait for next episode, was a great story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151353227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 632, 'last_played': 1469832488}
review:
Rewiev Stand Kapitel 1

Warum wird dies ein Spiel genannt? nach 4 stunden spielzeit habe ich mich 0 bewegt oder irgenteine Entscheidung getroffen die das Spiel Beeinflusst und das liegt daran das es keine Entscheidungen gibt. Die Geschichte ist an sich sehr angenehm. 7/10 ( es wird sehr viel Wiederholt - ich empfehle als Verbesserung das man bei jedem Save file load kurz etwas aufploppen sollte wo kurz die Geschichte zusammengefasst wird). Musik - 6/10 Man muss definitiv in die Einstellungen gehen und daran Rumwerken. Der Sound ist nicht Balanced man bekommt teilweise  Kopfweh oder  die Musik ist an der Falschen Stelle angesetzt. Ich empfehle als Grundeinstellung  Voice 67 BGM 30 Soundeffekt 31 System 36, ihr solltet dies aber auf euch selber appassen Paint 6/10 is teilweise sehr sch√∂n, allerdings sehr oft wiedervorkommend (manchmal in anderen Farben) Sonstiges: (geeignet ab 12 Jahre) :" ihr solltet grundlegende Englisch Kenntnisse haben. Wenn ihr anime Fan¬¥s seid und ein gutes vocabular habt k√∂nnte es euch gelegentlich auch etwas beibringen. es gibt viel Platz nach oben in diesem Spiel und ich hoffe man Arbeitet auch daran. 
Fazit- 19/30 Punkten + 3  (es gibt 1 bonuspunkte bei der Kategorie da man alles selbst einstellen kann + voice der Characktere + nebencharacktere/ 1 F√ºr Kostenlos / 1 F√ºr kinderfreundlich mit Vermittlung guter Werte). 
Jeder Mensch der sich f√ºr das Genre +Visual Novel + Wenig Geld zurverf√ºgung interesiert it hiermit gut aufgehoben.  Empfehlen w√ºrde ich es nur Menschen von dennen ich wei√ü das es ihnen auch gef√§llt.
Edit ; nach release von chapter 2 /3 hat sich leider meine Meinung zu diesem Spiel ge√§ndert. 
Solange es kostenlos ist, ist es in ordnung aber 20‚Ç¨ f√ºr Story verlangen ist,, meeeh! Kann man sich gleich ein buch kaufen :D oder einen Film mit der Freundin anschauen :3

author: {'steamid': '76561198180014437', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1466822950}
review:
Came for the boobs, instead got a history lesson, feels, an actually good plot, and boobs.

The VN tells the story of the 47 ronin quite well, with some often...distracting liberties taken here and there, if you get my drift, but kind of suprising to see a game do it's research. Only Chapter 1 has been released so far but definitely looking forward to the rest of it.

If there was only one flaw that I can point out is the fact that there are no choices. It's a fun read either way but monotonous clicking gets a little tiresome after awhile. Also, I didn't exactly like some of the choices that the main character made. I feel that the story would be much more involved if I could control the actions of the character to some degree.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120786125', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 913, 'last_played': 1470102602}
review: This game is an emotional rollercoaster, but the feels at the end are just unbelievable, this is probably the only game that I actually cried at, not just because it was sad (well mostly) but the fact that everytime it catches you off guard, all of this is so enjoying, and cannot wait for the next chapters (by the way Chapter 1 takes at least 8 hours so have fun with that). All in all it is just a beautiful story that will absolutely stun you with every twist and turn it offers. I had to play it a second time because it was that good and to prepare for when the next chapters come out. This game is nothing short of a masterpiece.(Also its free so thats really good)

author: {'steamid': '76561198229221352', 'num_games_owned': 815, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 706, 'last_played': 1470009265}
review: Franchement j'ai √©t√© tr√®s √©tonn√© par ce visual novel qu'est Chusingura 46+1 S, quand je l'ai t√©l√©charg√© je me serais attendu √† quelque chose d'assez m√©diocre mais c'est bien le contraire ce VN est s√ªrment le meilleur auquel j'ai pu jou√©: l'histoire est prenante j'ai pu d√©couvrir l'histoire en gros des 47 r√µnin et ce VN m'a donn√© envie d'en savoir plus, la romance est pr√©sente et la fin du premier chapitre m'a bris√© le c≈ìur (oui, oui j'ai bien marqu√© 1er chapitre je m'expliquerais plus tard), ensuite parlons du h√©ros: on sait qu'il a quelque chose de sp√©cial dans ses comp√©tences et on apprend au fur et √† mesure de l'histoire qu'il est sp√©cial mais qu'il a des faiblesses. Pour en revenir √† l'histoire des chapitres il y en a plusieurs (5 au total je crois) et tous sauf le 1er (bien s√ªr) seront certainement vendus en dlc (certes certains ne vont pas √™tre content mais faire un visual novel avec de tr√®s bons effets et o√π tout les personnages sauf le personnage principal qui se nomme Suguha ont une voix ce n'est pas gratuit) √† l'heure o√π j'√©cris cette √©valuation les chapitres 2 et 3 sont pr√©vus √† la fin du mois de juillet et m√™me si je ne sais pas a quel prix les prochains chapitres seront vendus (si ils seront payants) mais si ils le seront je les ach√®terais quand m√™me car j'ai envie de vivre la suite et fin de l'histoire de Suguha. Il y a aussi un autre point que j'aime dans ce VN: les musiques, certe certaines vont vite vous prendre la t√™te et vous aurez vite envie de couper la musique en question mais il en a d'autres celles o√π il y a du vocal qui seront inoubliables (par exemple les musiques d'op et d'ending). Mais bien s√ªr comme il faut un point n√©gatif √† ce VN et on retrouve cela √† presque tout les VN c'est la langue des sous-titres en anglais certes beaucoup auront un probl√®me avec cette langue (moi-m√™me j'ai eu des probl√®mes de compr√©hension √† certains endroits mais si vous avez les bases en anglais cela ne devrais pas √™tre un probl√®me √† la compr√©hension de l'histoire en elle-m√™me. Donc pour r√©sumer ce visual novel est quelque chose d'√©norme et tout le monde devrait au moins faire le premier chapitre.

Great Plot !

>.> ! Waiting for Other Chapters ! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198015033518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 18608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1294, 'last_played': 1605586018}
review:
A really good visual novel overall. I really enjoyed reading it, but at the same time I really regret reading it. Since only chapter 1 is available, you won't know what happens afterwards till a full release (my regrets...).

If your only interested in the fan service, this game is NOT recommended for you. Yes there is some partial nudity in some random scenes, but it's not much.

Read this if you're interested in a good story, not for good fan service. I'm looking forward to the full release.

PS: Also respect the fact that this is FREE.

review:
Honestly, this novel is boring. I couldn't play anymore of it, as there is no choice. It came to the point where i just skipped everything to get to the boobs. This isn't worth downloading.

The story is just flat out awful, timetravel? I don't think I've ever seen this in a Japanese game before. It's just really...obvious. It's just all the same, you keep going on about how you supposivley lost your memory, when you didn't... THIS GAME IS SHIT.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986463913', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1486234810}
review: Very good VN in my opinion and its free. Only thing that i didnt like was that its too linear, player has no choice at all. They should add atleast some choices for the player to make, even if that wont change the course of the story much as it would make the player feel more part of the story. I understand that they prob plan to make other paths into the locked chapters (atm it has 1 chapter, meaning 1 story path) but if they dont put any choices in its more like watching anime or reading a book. Overall in my book its 10/10 as i enjoyed it greatly.

review: ÂÖçË¥πÁöÑ‰∏çËØ¥„ÄÇËÄå‰∏îËøòÊòØÊó•ÊñáÁöÑ.steamÊ≠£Áâà‰∏çË¶ÅÈí±Ëæ£.‰∏çËøáÁúãÂºïÊìéÂ∫îËØ•ÊòØÁõ¥Êé•ÊääVITA‰∏äÁöÑÁõ¥Êé•ÁßªÊ§çËøáÊù•.ÁÑ∂ÂêéÂíåPCÁâàÁîªË¥®‰ΩúÂØπÊØî.Á®çÊúâÁëïÁñµ.ÊâÄ‰ª•Âπ∂Ê≤°ÊúâH„Ç∑„Éº„É≥.Âè¶Â§ñ+1ÂÖöÂ¶ÇÊûúËÉΩÁé©ÂÖ®ÈÄöËÇØÂÆö‰ºöËßâÂæóËøôÊ∏∏ÊàèÂ∫îËØ•Êî∂Ë¥π‰∫Ü...‰ª•‰∏ä

author: {'steamid': '76561198210350256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1469210033}
review:
Salutations, first off let me say that when I first downloaded this game I knew it was a demo but I only expected a few hours of gameplay like similar other demo. What you get is a lot more than that. Great story...check, well fleshed out characters...check, (excuse me for my french) A bastard that made me almost punch my computer...check. ChuSingura 46+1 S is so far a great Demo but there are a few cons as well.
First let start off with the few cons of the game before I begin singing praises. As stated this is only a demo with only the first chapter available and so that you know it is a kinetic novel as you won't have to make any decisions at all. Where I thought I could make decisions there was no choices to be made. The game gives you that feeling quite a bit at certain parts. There are a few typoes in the text so you have to guess what was said. Especially when there's only one word written, but you hear the characters speaking out whole sentences.
Now for the Pros of the game. Though this is a demo don't expect to finish it in one sitting for me it took about 30 hours of reading on auto and very little sleep.The story at first reminded me of the koihime series with a slight twist, but quickly steps out on it own. With some excellent foreshadowing and a few well placed twists and turns here and there the story draws you in. At times there are sad parts and tradegies that tug at your heart and make you cry. I did and I'm proud to admit it cause that's how immersed I was in the story. Not to say there aren't times of cuteness and silliness cause there is especially when it comes to Kuranosuke in her loli form and even Tsunayoshi on the rare occasion.
Characters are well fleshed out and draw you in with their individuality as well. The main villain in my P.O.V. is well done any time you want to punch your screen cause of how mad the villain gets you is a definite plus. The music is good and helps set the mood for you.
All in all this great game and I hope for more soon though to make it an all ages edition might take some time to do. Especially compared to the uncut original version even the opening is slightly different for obvious reasons. Thank you for taking your time read this and all hail Kuranosuke!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198016874070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1467331358}
review:
Boobs, feels, and plot.

...Plus its free.

I was really not expecting an extremely good story from this visual novel, but lo and behold, there it is. There are no choices to make in the game, as you basically time travel in the past to the Edo era, so those of you lookin to get it on with your genderbent waifu, nope, too bad. Once you get past all of its fanservice, the plot really gets to you. Sure it's cliche, with its "Lets have a likeable protag with some typical special skills!" but still, it had its charms and plot twists.

Give it a try. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198100347693', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1029, 'last_played': 1471545690}
review: I played through the entire game, but I found that there were still 10 characters missing in my Character list, and I only had one of the chapters unlocked. If anyone could give me any help on finding out how to unlock the other chapters, I would be extremely greatful! I loved the story and every single one of the characters (except the fat dude who messed with the curses), and I really, REALLY want to continue through the storyline if there is more to see. The art is incredible, the story is interesting and the fights actually kept me on the edge of my seat, literally. I have never been so interested in a visual novel before and I sugguest this game to anyone who wants to "enter' a new world.

review: Alright so I will start by issuing a warning if you think this a game like Stiens Gate or other Visual Novels you are wrong. There are no choices for the player to make during game play though there were many times they played it out like there could be a choice coming up. Though that aside the story is pretty well made and there is quite a deal of character development. So if you go into this like you are reading a book its good, just relax and enjoy the story and artwork.

review: This story was a 10/10, I'm not one who likes to play games that look like they are based on lewdness so the store icon threw me off a bit but I yolo'ed it and I am very satisified that it turned out to not be a game focusing on lewd stuff, This story set me on a roller coaster of feels the whole time. The only things that I can say were some spelling error (I know that the Mr. and those parts are a part of the story so I am not referring to that). bottom line, as a person who yolo'ed it, this is by far ONE OF THE BEST STORIES I HAVE EVER READ keep up the good work (do not let the time it says I have played I have another account cause I was scared it was gonna be a lewd game and didn't want people to think of me that way so I made another account just in case). Also people who are turning this game down because it doesnt have H+18 in it, you are weird.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099466085', 'num_games_owned': 275, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1040, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1533187750}
review: The overall story was great, i spend a good amount of time on this (and no not staring at the stuff) and it is a very good story, character development was great for most of the characters and for the first chapter of this, i think it was pretty satisfying. If I had to pay to get the other chapters that are still in dev i would happily get them to find out what happens next, this isn't just a free visual novel, the first chapter leaves you pondering the whole way finding out what happens next. Overall i didn't expect it to be good, but its in one of my top 10 visual novels.

author: {'steamid': '76561198216032136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 507, 'last_played': 1467176508}
review:
Oh my God. What a wonderful game.

This VN is basically a historical recount of the famous 47 Ronin story, albeit with some cute anime girls added in.

First off, yes, get it, it's wonderful.

It's an emotional rollercoaster, definitely. You'll feel love and happiness and hope and sadness, possibly all at once. Personally, I sort of fell in love with Chikara and Shinroku, but there's redeeming qualities in all the characters. It's a linear VN with no choices, but I felt engaged with the story and I was interested all the way through, despite that.

It's a marathon, but it keeps you into it until the very end. I won't spoil it for you, but the ending may surprise you.

By the end, I felt a connection to Suguha and all the girls (and Kitchenman, but we don't talk about him.)

The storytelling is very good at its core, despite the occasional spelling error or translation bug. Some words used by the Ronin hadn't even been invented yet (like "awesome") but I think I can give it a pass since it doesn't affect the storytelling.

This game appeals to anime fans, history lovers, or the offhand VN enthusiast. 

10/10, would cry again and tell my girlfriend that I love her out of the sadness this VN gave me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015571432', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 9179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1432, 'last_played': 1598117800}
review:
This visual novel is awesome!!!
Although it's just a part of the whole game and there is one already set route it doesn't really change the fact that it was a great experience for me. I don't know if the next parts will be free. I really doubt that but I can say already that it will be worth buying the rest for a full price. I didn't know that such a visual novel even existed until I have bumped on it when it just got released on Steam. Great job guys and I hope that you'll be able to translate and publish the rest of it. As for me I can assure all of you that I will be buying it as soon as it gets released. The music was pretty good but the best part was a sad piece of soundtrack but I am not going to give spoilers here. 
Do not get discouraged by haters saying that it is only a small part. It took me over 20 hours of constant reading to complete this 'small' part of the game. Many good visual novels would take that long to complete entire plot and routes... 
If you are a visual novel kind of person then I sincerely recommend this game to you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091743263', 'num_games_owned': 62, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 940, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 939, 'last_played': 1478036997}
review:
Ok, finished up the first chapter so... its review time...

+ Good Story
+ Time Travel (i love those, Hail Re: Zero and Steins' Gate)
+ Great/Lovable characters
+ Good Art
+ ITS FREE

- no CG library/collection
- no Uncensored / 18+ Patch Version (thats really a dealbreaker if they're going to release the full game someday, since I want the uncut version)
- because its censored, I didn't quite felt like Suguha and Kuranosuke's relationship progressed at all... guess why... BECAUSE THE BITS THAT WOULD SHOW THEY RELATIONSHIP PROGRESSING (H Scenes) GOT CUT OUT
- Short soundtrack that keeps looping, it got annoying at times
- Linear story, without any interaction of the player with the VN or choices that would lead to alternate endings on chapter 1

overall, not recommending it until they add a 18+ patch for the VN, its infuriating that an ADULT VISUAL NOVEL gets censored

author: {'steamid': '76561198074072128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 655, 'last_played': 1467930849}
review:
Wow...quite an interesting and long game and this is just one of the paths you are stuck with in this game. But others guess, this is not the full game and I guess when it comes out you will be able to make lots of choices that change the story somewhat.

The Game ended on a weird cliffhanger. I rather not spoil it nor the rest of the story.

So I think it was worth going through 100% of the game getting to know the story and characters better.

I do hope this gets finished in the (near) future with or without our help thorugh Kickstarter, even though it sadly failed twice. But maybe after alot play this game 100% or not, maybe more will be willing to help make the full true game possible.

So I HIGHLY recommend anyone interesting to play through this game Going to warn you it is violent at times, blood and a little nunity, so it is not for everyone!

review:
Before anything is said, this is another kinetic novel (Subject to change at a whim). There are no choices, as far as I have seen in the first chapter but may change, or any sort of gameplay to that extent. Thus, this is a kinetic novel with a preset story but it is still very, very good.

Opening Thoughts:
For a kinetic novel that is basically a free demo of the full release, I would have never pegged this as a demo. The art and proportions are a bit off. But the story is amazing. It captures your attention and makes you really feel for these characters. I hated Suguha at first due to his cowardly nature but I grew to like him as he matured and gained a backbone. The development is pretty good as I really felt emotion and depth with the characters.

Small Censorship Rant:
The 'demo' is hardly a demo. Yes, it is censored but so what? You are missing a few h-scenes that despite causing a bit of context loss, hardly mean anything. I've seen a fair few people complaining in the forums and in the reviews of this game about an uncensored version or patch(<-- This might be out when the full thing releases, as for an uncensored version just buy it somewhere that isn't steam.) I followed along the story well despite people saying that the censorship of certain parts cause portions to be hidden away.

The Verdict:
Anyways, back to the point at hand, this game is hardly a demo. With close to 10 hours of content, ChuSingura 46+1 S takes you on rollercoaster ride. You will laugh, hate, and cry alongside an ordinary Japanese student that took some kendo as he is transported 300 years into the past. Its story is captivating and truly interesting as he slowly sees the "inner workings" (as loosely as you can call this entire alternate history inner workings) of the 47 Ronin as they work to avenge their disgraced lord and family. I cannot wait for the full release as I will fully support the developers as they port the series into the PC realm. In all, this 'demo' is amazing and I suggest it to anybody looking for a well-written and captivating kinetic novel.

EDIT:
Broke as hell but I'm definitely gonna get it during the winter sales when I get enough money for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139435459', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 856, 'last_played': 1466812970}

author: {'steamid': '76561198040702503', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 15051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13349, 'last_played': 1476792933}
review:
[b]ChuSinGura46+1 S[/b] <CSG-46+1> is an excellent anime visual novel {VN} derived from the renowned Japanese [b]"47 Ronin"[/b] legend. The [b]"S"[/b] at the end of the title indicates it is a Premium Grade Japanese game.  It is offered as "free-to-play" on Steam, so the price is hard to beat !  Essentially, [b]CSG-46+1[/b] is an introduction to the full VN which includes 4 additional chapters.  Be aware that this is a mature tale with limited nudity, but there is no "hentai" in the Steam version.

Whereas [b]"47 Ronin"[/b] is an all male Samurai tale, [b]CSG-46+1[/b] is written from the perspective of a young male Protagonist who is mysteriously transported from 21st Century Tokyo to [b]Edo Period {circa 1700} Ako[/b] domain Japan.  He finds himself among a largely female Samurai society.  This is Chapter 1 of 5 of the VN and focuses on [b][u]your[/u] relationship with the Chamberlain[/b] {senior administrative and war leader} for the noble Asano family based in Ako in southwestern Honshu.  The following chapters develop alternate "realities" for the Protagonist in the Edo Period as he struggles to counter the tides of history.

[b]CSG-46+1[/b] delivers a gripping, often emotional, tale with voice acting in Japanese accompanied by available optional English or Japanese subtitles.  While the subtitle "messages" could stand some editing, they do not significantly detract from the story-line.  An especially nice feature is an appendix of Character profiles providing biographical details.  This is needed during game-play to help keep track of the inter-relationships among the extensive list of characters and the Protagonist.

I strongly recommend that any gamer interested in Visual Novels {or who just would like to read a good tale} at least try the "free-to-play" first chapter of [b]CSG-46+1[/b].  Personally, I enjoyed the "demo" sufficiently to buy all the follow-on Chapters with no regrets at all !!

review:

VIele historische Ereignisse welche dort Erw√§hnung finden sind sogar korrekt, einige in den groben Z√ºgen und vielen auch frei Erfunden.

Was aber aufs sch√§rfste Kritisiert werden muss ist die Zensur. 

Die Sex-Szenen k√∂nnen mir gerne gestohlen bleiben, das kann ich noch akzeptieren... Aber es ist unverst√§ndlich wie an gewissen Dialogen krampfhaft das Wort Sex oder der Akt an sich vermieden wird.

Alles in allem: Man f√ºhlt sich f√∂rmlich in die Zeit zur√ºck versetzt und die Abwechslung zwischen Slice of Life und spannende K√§mpfe halten sich in Wage, so das einem nicht langweilig wird.

Wer Interesse an japanischer Geschichte und/oder den 47 R≈çnin hat, dem ist diese Demo ans Herz zu legen.

review: I`ve got to say this game surprised me for a free to play demo. The artwork and the backgroundmusik are wonderfull. Also I would really like to buy the soundtrack of this game if Inre would release a dlc for that. The story in the beginning was not that much promising. I dont know why but it felt kinda off. But later in the game it got really a change of atmosphere and did make a cool ,,plot``. And I am not talking about that classy plottwist we know from anime. Respect to the Gamecreators for making such a good-looking, emotional and interesting visual novel. I am really looking forward for the next chapters of the game and wanted to thank you for creating such a great Game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047923248', 'num_games_owned': 100, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 566, 'last_played': 1466933734}
review:
Some context was a bit lost with the removal of H-scenes so there's that. Also, it's only one chapter for now. So it's a major cliffhanger and all that.

I found out that not only the main heroines are supposed to get scenes and cg's but also several side characters and even some female antagonists. So yeah, I'm a bit frustrated.

But if you don't try and discover all those missing scenes and are patient enough to wait for the other chapters, then go ahead.

Story is 10/10, art is okay. But all the other scenes that could have possibly made the relationship of the protagonist with the other ronin were omitted so that really made me feel negative about this game.

however there are bugs about fastforward button also i saw a scene repeated nearly at the end

author: {'steamid': '76561198144889936', 'num_games_owned': 346, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1467217680}
review: To be honest myself, this VN game are far more interesting to play rather than some VN I know in several genres. Basically, it is a story of a guy who met with historical 47 Ronin (I think?) but instead of male normally used in some VN game, they replaced with female counterpart (almost all of them, kinda). What makes this VN game so interesting that caught my attention is the synopsis, storyline, character development (especially the female Ronin) and yeah, relation of classic tale of 47 Ronin. That pretty amaze me at some point and this VN have it's own element that made it so special. It's worth to try (and it's free) and nothing is wasted.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212674217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1470560720}
review:
As someone who quite enjoys an actual storyline to these, I am Extremely happy to be able to say, the storyline to this novel is one that you can quite thoroughly enjoy, and on top of that, with only a small bit available, and many more chapters to come, this will leave you thirsting for much more.


Oh and a quick fix for anyone that encounters any bugs in the game, typically if you load a save it will fix it,
like when the characters are still monochrome in a colored scene the game will just stop letting itself progress, if your save on the spot, and load that save, its fixed
